DOC.brief_summary: TAXUS ATLAS Direct Stent global , multi-center , single-arm , noninferiority trial compare result patient TAXUS Liberté stent directly implant ( direct stenting ) versus result patient implantation TAXUS Liberté stent precede balloon angioplasty ( pre-dilatation ) . The Control group consist patient main TAXUS ATLAS trial , pre-dilatation mandatory . The primary objective compare outcome direct stenting balloon catheter pre-dilatation . The primary hypothesis late outcome direct stenting TAXUS™ Liberté Paclitaxel-Eluting Coronary Stent System non-inferior conventional implantation balloon catheter pre-dilatation
DOC.brief_title: Direct Stenting TAXUS Liberté™-SR Stent Treatment Patients With de Novo Coronary Artery Lesions
DOC.criteria: General 1 . Patient ≥18 year old . 2 . Eligible percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) 3 . Documented stable angina pectoris unstable angina pectoris document ischemia , document silent ischemia 4 . Left ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) ≥25 % 5 . Acceptable candidate coronary artery bypass grafting ( CABG ) 6 . Patient legal guardian understands study requirement treatment procedure provide write Informed Consent studyspecific test procedure perform 7 . Willing comply specify followup evaluation Angiographic 1 . Only one lesion appropriate direct stenting ( typically cover one 24 mm stent shorter ) , may treat study stent . However , one additional lesion nontarget vessel may treat index procedure commercially available bare metal stent , heparincoated stent TAXUS Express stent . 2 . Target lesion locate within single native coronary vessel 3 . Target lesion enrol treatment may compose multiple lesion ( 10mm diseased segment ) must completely cover one study stent . 4 . Cumulative target lesion length ≥10 mm ≤28 mm ( visual estimate ) typically consider appropriate direct stenting 5 . RVD ≥2.5 mm ≤4.0 mm ( visual estimate ) 6 . Target lesion diameter stenosis ≥50 % ( visual estimate ) 7 . Target lesion de novo ( i.e. , coronary lesion previously treat ) General 1 . Known hypersensitivity paclitaxel 2 . Any previous , concurrent plan treatment nonstudy antirestenotic drugcoated drugeluting coronary stent . 3 . Previous plan use study stent nonstudy stent ( i.e. , commercial stent ) treatment target vessel 4 . Previous plan treatment intravascular brachytherapy target vessel 5 . Planned CABG ≤9months postindex procedure 6 . MI within 72 hour prior index procedure and/or creatine kinase ( CK ) > 2x local laboratory 's ULN unless CKMB < 2x ULN . 7 . Cerebrovascular Accident ( CVA ) within past 6 month 8 . Cardiogenic Shock 9 . Acute chronic renal dysfunction 10 . Contraindication ASA , clopidogrel ticlopidine 11 . Patient currently warfarin anticipate treatment warfarin required period within 6 month index procedure . 12 . Leukopenia 13 . Thrombocytopenia 14 . Active peptic ulcer active gastrointestinal ( GI ) bleed 15 . Known allergy stainless steel 16 . Any prior true anaphylactic reaction contrast agent 17 . Patient currently , treat paclitaxel chemotherapeutic agent within 12months index procedure 18 . Anticipated treatment paclitaxel oral rapamycin period 9months index procedure 19 . Male female know intention procreate within 3 month index procedure 20 . Female childbearing potential positive pregnancy test within 7 day index procedure , lactate 21 . Life expectancy le 24months due medical condition 22 . Comorbid condition ( ) could limit patient 's ability participate study , compliance followup requirement impact scientific integrity study 23 . Unprotected leave main coronary artery disease ( patient protect leave main disease enrol target lesion RCA ) 2 . Target lesion ostial location ( within 3.0 mm vessel origin ) 3 . Target lesion and/or target vessel proximal target lesion moderately severely calcified visual estimate 4 . Target lesion and/or target vessel proximal target lesion tortuous 5 .
